div.p: Bookstore located at Vienna I, Graben 13.

The company was founded by Ludwig Wilhelm Seidel (1802-94) as L. W. Seidel & Co.. From 1861 to 1900, Seidel's eldest son Ludwig was involved, and in 1894 the company acquired the honorific title "K. u. k. Hofbuchh√§ndler" (Imperial and Royal Court Bookdealer). After Seidel's death, Heinrich Tachauer, Ludwig Wilhelm's grandson, became the new owner.
According to OJ 10/3, [3], the book dealership was taken over by Otto Erich Deutsch in November 1919.
Correspondence from Deutsch under the Seidel letterhead survives among OJ 10/3 (12 items: 1921-24).
